Reviews.Title: GREAT camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: LB
Reviews.Content: Crisp wonderful pictures, lots of options and scene modes. Crisp movies too! I wanted something inexpensive enough that I could take it sailing and other rough outdoor activities, and not be horrified if I lost it or damaged it, but still take great pictures. I had tried the Polariod digital camera in the same price point ($80) and it was horrible. I knew from that experience I had to have a fine lens (Wow - Leica!) and the option to chose flash on a button on the outside of the camera so I could quickly take flash photos (and not wait for a touch screen to eventually decide it could detect my finger!) I also knew I wanted a lithium battery for length of charge and a light weight camera (instead of heavy AA batteries.)Great camera! Only minor complaint - again consider what a great deal this is! - the battery door comes open too easily and fits a little loosely.I now carry this one with me all the time!

Reviews.Title: More dependable lens than Canon
Reviews.Author: Cobra Commander
Reviews.Content: We owned the power shot sd1300 is before buying this one.The powershot lens proved to have a short life span and was easily damaged.Where as the Lumix FH6 has a far superior lex lens and widescreen features.

Reviews.Title: No paper manual
Reviews.Author: handyman "Handyman"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, but no paper manual, yes available online, but would be nice to have small handy printed copy.Good on batteries too bad they had to have a rechargeable that has to be taken out each cycle, while it comes with a usb cord that would have 5volts available to charge and take out pictures at the same time, other models do it, I overlooked that feature thinking a rechargeable would certainly be within the camera, not.
